dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so, um, big news this week, Host_B. The U.S. has officially said they won't be joining this international effort for a COVID-19 vaccine.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so, um, big news this week, Host_B. The U S has officially said they won't be joining this international effort for a C O V I D nineteen vaccine.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The U.S. announced Tuesday that it would not join an international coalition to find and distribute a Covid-19 vaccine worldwide due to the group's association with the World Health Organization, the latest sign of the Trump administration withdrawing the country from the international health community's response to the pandemic over political concerns.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's pretty wild, isn't it? This initiative, Covax, it's trying to get two billion doses by the end of next year and, like, distribute them worldwide.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's pretty wild, isn't it? This initiative, Covax, it's trying to get two billion doses by the end of next year and, like, distribute them worldwide.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Covax is co-led by the World Health Organization, the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations and Gavi, which aims to purchase 2 billion doses of potential Covid-19 shots from several vaccine makers by the end of 2021 and distribute them worldwide.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and I guess the main sticking point for the U.S. is its association with the World Health Organization?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and I guess the main sticking point for the U S is its association with the World Health Organization?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The U.S. announced Tuesday that it would not join an international coalition to find and distribute a Covid-19 vaccine worldwide due to the group's association with the World Health Organization...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. The White House, um, specifically said they won't be "constrained by multilateral organizations influenced by the corrupt World Health Organization and China." That's the quote, basically.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. The White House, um, specifically said they won't be constrained by multilateral organizations influenced by the corrupt World Health Organization and China. That's the quote, basically.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The United States will continue to engage our international partners to ensure we defeat this virus, but we will not be constrained by multilateral organizations influenced by the corrupt World Health Organization and China, said Judd Deere, a spokesman for the White House.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. So, they're really doubling down on that stance, even though, like, the EU is throwing 400 million euros at it, and Germany's joined too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. So, they're really doubling down on that stance, even though, like, the E U is throwing four hundred million euros at it, and Germany's joined too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On Monday, the European Commission confirmed it would contribute 400 million euros ($478 million) to the initiative, and the WHO said Germany had joined the pact as well.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's a stark contrast. And, um, there's also this feeling within parts of the U.S. government that, like, they have enough vaccine candidates in trials to just "go it alone."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's a stark contrast. And, um, there's also this feeling within parts of the U S government that, like, they have enough vaccine candidates in trials to just go it alone.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the Washington Post, Health and Human Services Secretary Alex Azar had interest in exploring some type of role in Covax but there was resistance in some corners of the government and a belief that the U.S. has enough coronavirus vaccine candidates in advanced clinical trials that it can go it alone.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But isn't the WHO, you know, warning against that kind of "vaccine nationalism"? I remember Tedros, the head of the WHO, saying "for the world to recover faster, it has to recover together."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But isn't the W H O, you know, warning against that kind of vaccine nationalism? I remember Tedros, the head of the W H O, saying for the world to recover faster, it has to recover together.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The World Health Organization has warned against vaccine nationalism, with WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus stating, for the world to recover faster, it has to recover together, because it's a globalized world: the economies are intertwined.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlapping] Yeah, exactly what he said. It’s a globalized world, economies are intertwined.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly what he said. It's a globalized world, economies are intertwined.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The World Health Organization has warned against vaccine nationalism, with WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus stating, for the world to recover faster, it has to recover together, because it's a globalized world: the economies are intertwined.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, essentially, the U.S. is just, like, opting out of this massive collective effort.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, essentially, the U S is just, like, opting out of this massive collective effort.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. And experts are calling it, uh, a "real blow" to global health. Suerie Moon from the Global Health Center, she said it's gonna have political repercussions beyond just public health.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much. And experts are calling it, uh, a real blow to global health. Suerie Moon from the Global Health Center, she said it's gonna have political repercussions beyond just public health.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: When the U.S. says it is not going to participate in any sort of multilateral effort to secure vaccines, it's a real blow, said Suerie Moon, co-director of the Global Health Center at the Graduate Institute of International and Development Studies in Geneva. The behavior of countries when it comes to vaccines in this pandemic will have political repercussions beyond public health.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Which, you know, makes sense. I mean, this isn't the first time Trump has blasted the WHO either, right? He froze funding, accused them of being China-centric.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, you know, makes sense. I mean, this isn't the first time Trump has blasted the W H O either, right? He froze funding, accused them of being China-centric.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In early April, Trump blasted the World Health Organization, saying they called it wrong on the virus, that the WHO was very China-centric in its approach, and froze U.S. funding to the organization.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, for sure. He's been, like, very critical since early April. Accused them of downplaying the severity. He even sent a letter about withdrawing from the WHO entirely back in July.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, for sure. He's been, like, very critical since early April. Accused them of downplaying the severity. He even sent a letter about withdrawing from the W H O entirely back in July.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In early April, Trump blasted the World Health Organization... suggesting the group had gone along with China's efforts to downplay the severity of the outbreak. In July, the administration sent a letter signaling its intent to withdraw from the WHO.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It just feels, uh, so counterproductive when we're talking about a global pandemic.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It just feels, uh, so counterproductive when we're talking about a global pandemic.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. The Swedish Prime Minister, Stefan Löfven, he put it well: "Equal access to a COVID-19 vaccine is the key to beating the virus... This cannot be a race with a few winners."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. The Swedish Prime Minister, Stefan Löfven, he put it well: Equal access to a C O V I D nineteen vaccine is the key to beating the virus... This cannot be a race with a few winners.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Equal access to a COVID-19 vaccine is the key to beating the virus and paving the way for recovery from the pandemic, said Stefan Lfven, the prime minister of Sweden. This cannot be a race with a few winners...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that really sums it up. You know, you can't beat a global virus with a fragmented approach.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that really sums it up. You know, you can't beat a global virus with a fragmented approach.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Precisely. It's, like, a really complicated situation with, you know, huge implications for everyone.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Precisely. It's, like, a really complicated situation with, you know, huge implications for everyone.
